channel.title: Firefox encountered an error and needs to close
channel.description: This happens when i start runescape, login applets, or any other type of java, it crashes after it freezes when the page is accessed, and java is enabled.

item.title: Firefox encountered an error and needs to close
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Rangers_Apprentice, post:18, topic:191555”]Haha, Cain, your persistent I see. Mm… Is ‘‘faggot’’ the only word you have in your feeble vocabulary? But, alls well that ends well. Call me what you want, I can take your words, for they are weak and meager, just as your name.

Nice job asshole.

Frell, IE is a great browser. Download Internet Explorer 7, and you can have your tabs. Just search for it on Google. And again, thank you Frell.

Have fun.[/quote]

You’re a retard if you think IE is a great browser. Not only does it completely fail standards compliance, it’s one of the most targeted browsers for attacks. Case-in-point:

http://secunia.com/product/12366/?task=advisories

Compare with http://secunia.com/product/10615/?task=advisories

item.title: Firefox encountered an error and needs to close
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:27, topic:191555”][quote author=Frell link=topic=255194.msg2133794#msg2133794 date=1206422102]

Firefox is CRAP when it comes to playing games on it. I mean don’t get me wrong, it’s a brilliant browser, for searching, ect. But for playing games it’s absolutely horrific. Just download Internet Explorer, then play your Runescape upon there. It’ll be faster, and may actually work…

wow faggot gtfo. and quite spamming.

At least he uses proper grammar.
[/quote]
u c dis r y no1 liks u cus ur gay[/quote]
Im just saying, its getting pretty old…

“happy birthday Yz” - topic

“Dicks” - Cains post

Thats all he does, sitting around trying to be lawl. There should only be one lawl. And the one with a vaginal cavity is him

Well anyway, i went to the gayfox forums, over night, only one post

For the past 1.5 weeks, Mozilla/Firefox has been crashing - Encountered a problem and must close.

I am not sure what is causing it or how to stop it. I have been using Mozilla/Firefox exclusively because of everything it offers, ease of use, on an on. However, with this latest development, I am forced back to Internet Explorer.

Each time I am logged off, I have been in the middle of work and have to redo something; even though Mozilla/Firefox provides a function that allows you to continue with a previous session.

My love for Mozilla/Firefox has not waned however, I cannot afford to redo my work over and over again.

Please share a fix for this problem.

I have not downloaded the ‘beta’ – I believe this would be disasterous at this time.

Any advice shared would be greatly appreciated.


And that was it…

Read full topic

Next, I was simply applieing my opinion. Don’t try to ‘‘best-me’’, for your not very witted.

Have fun. ;)[/quote]You mis-spelled grammar, and when adding ing to words(eg. lie)you change the ie to a y. And the funny thing is, apply isn’t even supposed have ie in the first place. I suggest you stfu now, you’ve already lost any respect you’d ever gain around here.

item.title: Firefox encountered an error and needs to close
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:14, topic:191555”]I’ve never had that kind of a problem with firefox, in fact firefox (I don’t think) has ever crashed for me with the exception of when I run too many programs at once. What I would do is first make sure you have the latest Java/JRE (if that link is no good search google), then uninstall firefox and re-install it. Unless you have already tried that of course.

If that doesn’t work try IE and see if it loads right.[/quote]
Tried all that, i just wish IE was as fast and good looking as firefox, i just want to have everything in my tabs =[[[[

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox encountered an error and needs to close
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

I’ve never had that kind of a problem with firefox, in fact firefox (I don’t think) has ever crashed for me with the exception of when I run too many programs at once. What I would do is first make sure you have the latest Java/JRE (if that link is no good search google), then uninstall firefox and re-install it. Unless you have already tried that of course.

If that doesn’t work try IE and see if it loads right.
